greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the coefficient c_m in c_m*log(N), the asymptotic mean number of factors in a random factorization of n <= N.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.5. Kalmár’s Composition Constant, p. 293.
link: Steven R. Finch, Errata and Addenda to Mathematical Constants, p. 41.
formula: c_m = -1/zeta'(rho), where rho = 1.728647... is A107311, the real solution to zeta(rho) = 2.
mathematica: digits = 101; rho = x /. FindRoot[Zeta[x] == 2, {x, 2}, WorkingPrecision -> digits+5]; cm = -1/Zeta'[rho]; RealDigits[cm, 10, digits] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 22 2014
